patch:
@@ -1,12 +1,4 @@
 # Google Software Product Sprint
 
-This repo contains the projects you'll work on throughout SPS.
+This repo contains Conrad's portfolio and SPS projects.
 
-To get started:
-
-- Login to [Google Cloud Shell](https://ssh.cloud.google.com/cloudshell/editor)
-- Clone this repo: `cd; git clone https://github.com/google/software-product-sprint.git`
-- Open the GitHub setup walkthrough: `teachme ~/software-product-sprint/walkthroughs/week-0-setup/github-setup-walkthrough.md`
-  - If the tutorial panel does not open or display the walkthrough contents, try refreshing the page.
-
-Then follow the on-screen instructions to set up your repo.

@@ -5,15 +5,34 @@ My Portfolio +
-

My Portfolio

-

This is my portfolio.

-

Click here to see content created by server code.

-

Click here to get a random message:

- -
-
+

Conrad Obeng's Portfolio

+ +

My name is Conrad Obeng, and I'm a student at The University of Texas at San Antonio.

+ LinkedIn + Github +

Projects

+

Internet Controlled Robot, Guided Project

+

Created a robot that would respond to instructions given to it from a localhost website. + Worked with a Raspberry Pi using Python to execute the robot instructions. + Soldered parts of the project working with various tools including motor controllers and battery systems.

+

Automated Vinegar Dispenser, Individual Project

+

Created an automated tool to dispense vinegar into an air conditioning system for maintenance purposes. + Worked with a pump system to move the vinegar from one container to another, + and an Arduino system for time-keeping and fluid levels.

+

Scheduling Manager Program, Individual Project

+

Programmed a tool in Python to allow for scheduling and assigning of doctors to patients, saving manual labor time. + Worked with Python dictionaries and list systems in order to design and implement solutions to the workplace issues.

+

Local Temperature System, Guided Project

+

Created a readable tool to update weather forecasts in real time. + Worked with API scripts and web scraping in order to send data from websites to the Raspberry Pi System.

+ + +

+

Click here to see fetch content.
